text.0: o heavenly dawn awaken us to ample opulence today.
text.1: even as thou hast wakened us with satyasravas vayyas son highborn delightful with thy steeds.
text.2: daughter of heaven thou dawnedst on sunitha sucadrathas son.
text.3: so dawn thou on one mightier still on satyasravas vayyas son highborn delightful with thy steeds.
text.4: so bringing treasure dawn today on us thou daughter of the sky.
text.5: as thou o mightier yet didst shine for satyatravas vayyas son highborn delightful with thy steeds.
text.6: here round about thee are the priests who laud thee bright one with their hymns.
text.7: and men with gifts o bounteous dame splendid with wealth and offering much highborn delightful with thy steeds.
text.8: whatever these thy bands perform to please thee or to win them wealth.
text.9: een fain they gird us round and give rich gifts which neer are reft away highborn delightful with thy steeds.
text.10: give to these wealthy patrons fame o affluent dawn with hero sons.
text.11: to these our princes who have brought rich gifts neer to be reft away highborn delightful with thy steeds.
text.12: bring lofty and resplendent fame o thou munificent dawn to these.
text.13: our wealthy patrons who bestow rich gifts on us of steeds and kine highborn delightful with thy steeds.
text.14: bring us o daughter of the sky subsistence in our herds of kine.
text.15: together with the sunbeams with the shine of pure refulgent flames highborn delightful with thy steeds.
text.16: o daughter of the sky shine forth delay not to perform thy task.
text.17: let not the sun with fervent heat consume thee like a robber foe highborn delightful with the steeds.
text.18: so much and more exceedingly o dawn it suits thee to bestow.
text.19: thou radiant one who ceasest not to shine for those who sing thy praise highborn delightful with thy steeds.
